document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the cleptoparasitic bee genus Epiclopus Spinola, 1851 (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Ericrocidini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the cleptoparasitic bee genus Epiclopus Spinola, 1851 (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Ericrocidini)

bibRefCitation.refString: Spinola, M. (1851) Himenopteros. In: Gay, C. (Ed.), Historia Fisica y Politica de Chile. Zoologia. Vol. 6. Casa del autor, Paris, pp. 153 - 569.

FIGURES 10–13.
Epiclopus gayi
. Fig. 10. Female (Chile: Viña del Mar): Head, frontal view (scale bar 1 mm). Fig. 11. Female: Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 5 mm). Fig. 12. Male (Chile: Cajón del Maipo): Head, frontal view (scale bar 1 mm). Fig. 13. Male: Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 5 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Male genitalia. See figures 14–17 .

Type material.
Epiclopus gayi
: syntypes male and female Museo Regionale di Scienze Naturale, Torino, Italy ( MSNT , not examined).
Melecta Chiliensis
: holotype female with the following information: Type H. T. [white round label with red edge]\ syntype [white round label with light blue edge]\ B. M. HYM 14 .B. 495 [white label with “ 14 .B. 495 ” handwritten]\
Melecta Chiliensis
[white label]\ Chili [white round label handwritten]\ Smith coll. pres by Mrs. Farren White. 99-303 [white label]\ BMNH (E) # 969431 [white label] ( BMNH , examined).

: syntypes male and female ( ZMB ). Lectotype male here designated with the following information: Chile Concepc_
